oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Risk Factors for Neospora caninum Infection and Associated Abortion in Ontario Holstein Dairy Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hobson, J.
Duffield, T.
Peregrine, A.
McEwen, B.
Hietala, S.
Kelton, D.
Lissemore, K.
Leslie, K.
Cramer, G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Neospora caninum
abortion
epidemiological study
risk factors
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Neospora caninum has been identified as a major cause of abortion in dairy cattle worldwide. The objective of this component of an epidemiological study investigating N. caninum in Ontario was to identify risk factors for N. caninum serostatus and related abortions in Ontario Holstein dairy herds.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2001; 179
